column2: TEOCO Corporation (www.teoco.com ), 27 years old Product based Organization, specialization in Telecom sector, head quarter at Virginia, USA has  position for  Lead Audit Analyst at Kolkata. We have 20 offices all over the World and 4 offices in India. Position: Lead Audit Analyst   Location: Kolkata  Full time permanent position   We are looking for an individual with experience leading an analytical team.  The ideal candidate would have experience doing telecommunications cost analysis or would be willing to do the analytical work themselves so that they could support their team.  This is not a process driven group, so we are not looking for a process-driven type person.  We need someone who is creative that can lead from the front. Role & responsibilities     TEOCOs audit team is  looking for a driven, team focused and highly analytical team lead.  The Cost Analyst team lead will  manage a team responsible for analyzing client invoice data to identify vendor  overbillings by applying general audit principals such as pattern recognition,  data filtering, and cross referencing of multiple data sources.  The team lead (applicant) and  his/her team will be required to research and analyses contracts, applicable  tariffs, Interconnection Agreements, and other sources of data and find out  disputes among services/circuits and applicable tariff and contract rates.  The team lead and his/her team will  be given a monthly and yearly revenue target to achieve.  Other source data may include  industry databases such as LERG (Local Exchange Routing Guide) and NECA  (National Exchange Carrier Association), client provisioning systems, internal  TEOCO software tools such as BillTrak Pro, SONAR, and NEO, and external  software tools such as CO-Finder and Google Earth.   The team will leverage some or all  of the following software tools as part of daily activities: MS Excel, SQL, MS  Access, Python, Alteryx and Business Objects.    Team lead will analyze any responses  from vendors and provide on-going support to the reconciliation team to help  resolve issues on behalf of the client with the vendor.  Employee may be called, on occasion,  to participate in calls with clients and vendors to explain claim issues to  obtain approval and favorable resolutions. Preferred candidate profile     Proficiency in MS Excel, MS Access, MS Word, and MS Outlook. Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills, coupled with strong communication abilities. Experience  with Telecom order to bill processes. Bachelor's Degree, preferably in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, or Statistics. Perks and benefits
